title: Science

articles.content:
Science was born as a result and consequence of philosophy; it cannot survive
without a philosophical (particularly epistemological) base. If philosophy
perishes, science will be next to go.
articles.attribution:
“For the New Intellectual,”
For the New Intellectual, 44

articles.content:
It is not the special sciences that teach man to think; it is philosophy that
lays down the epistemological criteria of all special sciences.
articles.attribution:
“Consciousness and Identity,”
Introduction to Objectivist Epistemology, 78

articles.content:
The disintegration of philosophy in the nineteenth century and its collapse in
the twentieth have led to a similar, though much slower and less obvious,
process in the course of modern science.
articles.attribution:
“What Is Capitalism?”
Capitalism: The Unknown Ideal, 11

acknowledgement:
“For the New Intellectual,”
For the New Intellectual, 44
